intro: Ivesia pickeringii, commonly known as Pickering's ivesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky slopes and sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, hard fruits that contain seeds. Ivesia pickeringii is often found in desert regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
